subject: Mental Health
title: The Gut-Brain Anxiety Link
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: The Gut-Brain Anxiety Link.

hook.text: Your gut has over 100 million neurons, earning it the nickname second brain.

buildup.text: The vagus nerve connects your gut and brain in a two-way communication line.

discovery.text: Gut bacteria produce about 90 percent of the body's serotonin.

twist.text: Disrupted gut microbiome is consistently linked to higher anxiety levels.

climax.text: Probiotics have reduced anxiety symptoms in several clinical trials.

punchline.text: Sometimes anxiety starts in your stomach.

quiz.question: What percentage of serotonin is produced in the gut?
